div.p: In an effort to minimize the risk of spreading the Coronavirus (COVID-19), City Hall will be closed to the public until further notice.Â Residents and businesses can contact City Hall Departments during hours of operation by calling City Hall and its employees. A drop box will also be available at City Hall.Â For COVID-19 information in the City of Pawtucket, please visitÂ http://www.pawtucketri.com/COVID19.Â

div.span: Cape Verdean Organizations Commit to BEAT COVID-19

div.h2: Cape Verdean Organizations Commit to BEAT COVID-19

span.content: Cape Verdean Organizations Commit to BEAT COVID-19

p.span: â Cape Verdean organizations, the Cape Verdean Community Development (CACD) and Project Health Cape Verde, have committed to the BEAT COVID-19 initiative alongside Mayors Donald R. Grebien and James A. Diossa. Over half of Rhode Islandâs roughly 20,000 Cape Verdeans are located in Pawtucket and Central Falls.

span.img: The Cape Verdean community has played a major role in the ongoing economic development, sense of community, and prosperity of Pawtucket and Central Falls. This population often get lost in the way that we count, noted Mayor Grebien and Mayor Diossa. Latinos and African-Americans are counted, but members of the large community of Cape Verdeans are not counted as being part of a community with its own unique history, character and identity. Grebien and Diossa recognized CACD and Project Health Cape Verde for their integral role in communicating with such a significant segment of their citiesâ population.

p.span: âCACD has always been tasked with bridging the gap between Cape Verdeans and the community. Now more than ever, our community needs us to assist them through these challenging times. Our goal is to ensure that Cape Verdeans and all other residents alike are taking the necessary precautions to minimize the risk of the coronavirus and getting tested if they have symptoms,â said Executive Director Sandy Soares.

âProject Health Cape Verde understands the importance of providing medical services to the community. In order to do so, we need to reach individuals and help them understand the magnitude of the pandemic that we are in. We are proud to align with Pawtucket, Central Falls, and Dr. Fine to combat the virus,â said Director of Operations Elizabeth D. Moreira, MHA. âWe will continue to partner with CACD to understand the interrelated conditions, and social and economic determinants that influence the health status of Cape Verdeans in order to increase cultural competency within healthcare systems.â

CACD and Project Health Cape Verde have supplied BEAT COVID-19 with translation services, volunteers, resources, and outreach for the hard to reach Cape Verdean, Portuguese, and Latino populations in Pawtucket and Central Falls. BEAT COVID-19 is focusing on grassroots communication and assistance with the goal of reaching out to every single household in the two cities, including identifying residents who become symptomatic as soon as they get sick and move them to effective isolation immediately.

A coronavirus testing site will be staffed by CNE medical professionals Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm. Symptomatic patients should call their primary care provider or call 401-CareNOW (401-227-3669) to make an appointment.

i.span: The Cape Verdean American Community Development Agency is a 501(c)3 Non-profit Community Organization in Rhode Island.

CACD serves as a common meeting ground for all Cape Verdeans. Its basic aim is to develop and enrich human personality through group association within the framework of American democratic ideals and the fundamental traditions of Cape Verdean culture. To fulfill this aim, it utilizes all the resources and skills of informal education and leisure time planning.

Project Health CV Inc. is a non-profit organization founded in 2009 by medical staff from Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. The missionâs purpose is to provide medical as well as specialized surgical services in Cape Verde.
PHCV Inc. is dedicated to improving lives by introducing world class medical care to the people of Cape Verde and providing those in need access to general and preventative healthcare information.

div.p:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
April 28, 2020
Contact: Wil Arboleda
401-728-0500 ext. 358

b.span: Organizasons Kabu-Verdianus ta kumprumete na DIRROTA COVID-19

p.span: - organizasons Kabu-Verdianus, Agencia de Desenvolvimentu Kumunitariu Kabu-Verdianu (CACD) eÂ Project Health Cape Verde, ta Kumprumeti Kum iniciativa diÂ DIRROTA COVID-19 djunto ku presidentes da camra, Donald R. Grebien e James A. Diossa. Mas di metadi di serka di 20.000 Kabo-Verdianus di Rhode Island ta localiza na Pawtucket e Central Falls.

KumunidadiÂ Kabo-Verdianu tem disempenhado um papel importanti na desenvolvimentu ikunomiku em andamento, na sentidu de kumunidade e na prosperidadi de Pawtucket e Central Falls. Es populaÃ§Ã£o geralmente ta perdi na maneiraÂ ki nu ta kontas, sima presidentis Grebien eÂ Diossa observa. Latinos e Afro-Amerikanus ta kontadu, ma membrus di grande Kumunidade di Kabu-Verdianus ka ta Kontadu sima parti de um Komunidadi ku se historia uniku , karÃ¡ter e identidadi. Grebien e Diossa rikunheci CACD e Project Health Cape Verde pa ses papel issencial na kumunicason ku es segmentu ton signifikativu di populason de ses cidadis.

â CACD sempri foi incumbidu di stabeleciÂ ponti entri Â Kabu-Verdianos eÂ Kumunidade. Gosi, mas du ki nunka, nos Kumunidadi sta mesti di nos assistenciaÂ duranti es tempus difÃ­cil. Nos objectivu Ã© garanti ma Kabu-Verdianos e tudu kes otos risidentis sta toma precausons nisisariu pa minimiza risku di coronavÃ­rus e pes ser testadu ses teni sintomas â, afirma diretora executiva Sandy Soares.

â Project Health Cape Verde ta intendi impurtancia di presta servisus medikus pa kumunidadi. Pa kela, nu mesti alkansa indivÃ­dus e djudasÂ intendi magnitudi de pandemia ki nu staÂ vivi. Nu tem orgulhu di asosia Ku Pawtucket, Central Falls e Dr. Fine pa kombati es vÃ­rus â, afirmaÂ diretora di operasons. Elizabeth D. Moreira, MHA. âNu ta continua nos parseria ku CACD pa nu intendi midjor kesÂ condisons inter-rilacionadus e kes diterminantis sucial e ikunomiku ki ta influencia estadu di saÃºde di Kabu-Verdianus, ku finalidadi di aumenta Kompitencia cultural na sistema di saudi.â

CACD e Project Health Cape Verde tem asistidu na DIRROTA COVID-19Â ku servisus di tradusons, voluntarius, ricursus e divulgason na populason Kabo-Verdianu, Portugues e Latinu di asesu dificil na Pawtucket e Central Falls. DIRROTA COVID-19 sta focadu na Kumunikason basiku e asistensia, ku objetivu di alcansa kada familia de kes dos sidadis, incluinduÂ identifikason di kes risidentis ki xinti sintomas pa sim kes fika duenti pes ser transfiriduÂ imediatamenti pa um isolamento eficienti.

Site pa testagem di coronavÃ­rus ta serÂ formadu pa prufisional medikus di CNE di segunda a sexta-feira, 8h di sedu paÂ 5h di tardi. Pacientis kuÂ sintomas devi liga se mediku de famÃ­lia o liga 401-CareNOW (401-227-3669) pe marca um consulta.

i.span: Â Agencia de Disenvolvimentu Komunitariu Kabuverdianu-Americanu, Ã© um 501 (c) 3 organizason komunitÃ¡riuÂ sem fim lucrativus, na Rhode Island.

CACDÂ ta sirviÂ sima um pontu de enkontru kumum pa tudoÂ Kabu-Verdianus. Se objectivo bÃ¡siku Ã© disenvolviÂ e inriquiciÂ personalidadi humanu atravez di assosiason di grupus enquadradu dentu diÂ idealsÂ dimokratikus americanu e di tradisons fundamentalÂ di kultura Kabu-Verdianu. Pe cumpri se objetivo, Ã© ta utiliza tudo rikursus e habilidadis di idukason informal e planejamentu di tempu di lazer .

Project Health CV Inc. Ã© um organizason sem fim lucrativus fundadu na 2009 pa um equipa mediku di Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. Objetivo di mison Ã© di prupurciona servisus medikus e sirurgicus spicializadus na Cabo Verde.

A PHCV Inc. ta dedica pa midjora de vidas, introduzindu cuidadus medikus di nÃ­velÂ mundial pa povu de Kabo Verdi e oferesenduÂ pa kes mas necisitadusÂ asesu a informasons geral e preventivu sobriÂ Kuidados di saudi.

div.div: "The birthplace of the American Industrial Revolution, Pawtucket is poised to undergo a 21st century evolution into Rhode Island's premier arts and cultural destination, an ideal community to live, work, play, start a business and raise a family."
